info.name: Azure OpenAI Agent Start
info.description:
Postman collection for testing Azure OpenAI Agent Start API.

**Features:**
- Simple agent interaction without thread support
- Singleton GlobalAgent created at startup
- Direct question-answer flow

**Configuration:**
- Agent configuration is defined in appsettings.json under AgentConfiguration

**Endpoints:**
- POST /api/agents/ask - Send questions to the agent

item.name: Agents

request.description:
Sends a question to the AI agent asking for the top 5 largest companies in the S&P 500, requesting the response as a list.

The agent is a singleton GlobalAgent created at startup.

**Request Body:**
- `question` (required, string): The question or message to send to the agent

**Response:**
Returns an AgentResponse containing:
- `agentId`: The agent identifier
- `createdAt`: Timestamp of the response
- `messages`: Array of messages in the response (includes both user and assistant messages)
- `usage`: Token usage information (inputTokenCount, outputTokenCount, totalTokenCount, additionalCounts)

response.name: Success Response

item.description:
Endpoint for asking questions to the AI agent.

**POST /api/agents/ask**

Sends a question and receives a response from the singleton GlobalAgent created at startup. The agent provides:
- **Direct question-answer flow**: Simple interaction without conversation threads
- **Token usage tracking**: Monitor API usage with detailed token counts

**Note:** Each request is independent - there is no conversation context maintained between requests.

variable.description: Base URL for the API. Default is http://localhost:5241 (matches launchSettings.json). Update this if your API is running on a different port or host. The API also supports HTTPS on port 7044.
